39431912.review:
A short initial review of Creeper World 3: Arc Eternal from what I have gathered and played so far.

[h1]Story:[/h1]
Creeper World 3: Arc Eternal (CW3) is set several billion years after the events of CW2. The protagonist wakes up from stasis (having been in stasis since CW2 roughly) only to discover the majority of humanity was completely wiped out by an alien species known as the Creeper. The story goes into much more detail as you play. It's okay to not play the previous games as the story can be easily figured out for those new to the series but does make references to past titles in the series.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]
Every unit and action in this game has its own unique sound effect, making it easy to know when and/or which unit has blown up, landed, fired, etc. without even looking for it.

[h1]Friendly Units (RTS):[/h1]
The units in CW3 are fantastic. Every single unit that is used has a purpose and does it extremely well. Normally in an RTS there is only a handful of units the player would use but in CW3, its better to use practically all of them! You start off with the fairly cheap but still useful cannon. As you go through the game you begin to unlock other units such as mortars, Strafers (jets that strafe the Creeper), transport aircraft, etc.

[h1]Enemy Units (RTS):[/h1]
The Creeper also has its fair share of units to throw your way. Everything from the standard blob/horde creeper to those that can stun your units, prevent air units from firing, etc!

[h1]Content:[/h1]
What CW3 does in terms of content puts similar AAA studios in the same genre(s) to shame. The story alone has around 20+ missions. Each taking anywhere from a few minutes to a an hour (all depending on your playstyle and experience). CW3 also contains what is essentially a random map generator (known as the Dial Map Device (DMP). This powerful generator gives you hours of possible designs. If you want something a little more specific, CW3 also offers a map editor that is equally powerful in tools. This review can't even comprehend the full scope of content available (and I am not even getting into maps added by other players in the community).

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
The meat and potatoes of this game is amazing. It's highly addictive RTS like design (though you can pause or even speed up gameplay at your whim) will keep you on the edge of your seat. Like most RTS's, you start off by placing down what are known as collectors that gives you power. Collectors are also used to transport resources to your other units (like "ammo" for your turrets). A faster alternative are relays which can quickly move resources around and has extended range but are more expensive and don't produce energy. Players could put down reactors for a large energy boost but take time to build and could put you in a 0 energy status (bad!). You will encounter maps that may force you to go on the heavily defensive while others could have you be suppressing literal volcanos of Creeper from oozing out! There is so much I could cover for gameplay but you will just have to try it out yourself to experience it!

Final Conclusion:
For the 3rd game of the series, this only adds to the formula and improves everything else. For its price as well (lowest I saw was $2 a few years ago I believe) you will get so much bang for buck. Get it now!

I had seen this game floating around steam with its many prequels and honestly I thought it looked kinda low budget and guessed it would either not be my type of thing as I've never really liked tower defence, or that it would lack depth having allegedly only one type of enemy.

But I saw a let's play of it and, well, it looked cool, so I bought it.

And I have to say it's a really fun RTS game. The creeper enemy has lots of different ways of behaving depending on the terrain so the game is really terrain based, and solving levels is almost like a puzzle. I wouldn't say it's very difficult although I am only a short way into the campaign, I think, but it's definitely engaging. Honestly I recommend it even if you don't like TD because it plays completely unlike a tower defence game even though it takes a lot of the mechanics from one. It's not about hammering bricks of HP enemies while they trundle through a maze, every hit on the creeper has an actual effect on it, and there's no silly waves of random enemies to throw off your plan, the level is clear what's going to be thrown at you, you just need to find a way to deal with it. And honestly there's a kind of bonsai pleasure in building little terraformed forts as well.

It's good, basically, give it a shot.

38868707.review: One of those brilliant genre-busting games. Like other reviewers have said, I usually don't like tower defense games. This isn't really Tower Defense so much as it is Tower Offense. You're attacking the enemy base by using (movable) towers. There's many different ways to beat the level, and there's something immensely satisfying about knocking back that ooze until you've owned the board. Then I'd finish a mission, be really proud and confident in my accomplishments, and then watch a YouTube video about it where that 45 minute mission I just played was speed-run in 4 minutes. The difficulty ramps up smoothly and by the end you'd be able to go back to a previously challenging mission and crush it with your new skill. Highly recommended, even if you don't usually like tower defense games. This is awesome fun. The story is actually compelling and interesting for the most part.

38406516.review:
Great RTS game with TD elements.

I expected usual Tower Defense game when I was buying this game, but I got a kinda innovative game with a lot of cool features. Creeper World is a game where you build towers to defense yourself in the early game and then you build towers to offense the enemy :D 

Every game starts with placing Command Center. It produces few energy. Then you need to "conquer" as much as possible neutral territory with Collector building to increase production of energy. While you are doing this the blue thing called Creeper is constantly conquering other territories. Then it tries to conquer you. You start building towers. It costs energy. Towers are shooting, CC sends extra ammo. It costs energy too. 

So, there comes the first great feature of the game, Creeper World is a strategy game where you need to find the perfect balance between production and consumption of energy. It is easy to conquer territory in the beginning, but it is much harder to defend it, because each tower consumes a lot of energy. The larger territory produces more energy but requires more towers. If you are greedy you will lose. In this game you need to think strategically. Find the safest place, make defense, be sure that it is unbreakable. Then start your offense.

So as I said at first this game is a survival city management. Pretty cool!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1235205395

Usually you need to kill all Creeper hosts to complete a level. So there starts the second part of the game, Offense. When you have unbreakable defense you need to produce enough towers, prepare enough energy for ammo and find the place where you will attack. In the first missions of campaign you just take enemy territory by small steps. In the later stages it doesn't work. You need to find the weakest spot of enemy, make artillery preparation, when send air fleet and then comes with ~15 pulse cannons. After that you will have 10 seconds to clean a small piece of territory from the creeper and build a Relay for recaharge ammo of your towers. It is really easy to lose, but you will feel incredible feelings when your the small assault succeed and you will have an small blockpost in the heart of enemy territory.

Actually, it's the hardest part of each mission,  make an succeed assault. You are like commander Eisenhower which controls Operation Overlord. Awesome experience.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1235205423

There is also a good story line with a kinda interesting plot. Game designers made great jobs, each new story missions offer you new buildings/enemies/game features. So it engages you until all campaign is finished. I passed it in less than 12 hours for 2 days. It was a game with really fresh gameplay mechanics for me. I was surprised

Pros
- Fresh gameplay idea. It's really cool
- Well done campaign with good story and interesting variation between missions.
- A lot of stuff after completing the campaign: custom missions, daily missions, missions made by community.
- A lot of ways to complete any mission.

Cons
- Sometimes confusing controls. You can't deselect unit with right button. You must click Cancel button.
- No difficulty settings. I suppose it could be really hard for casual players.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1235205477

[h1]Resume[/h1]
A great strategy game with fresh mechanics. Someone could find the graphics outdated, but you will forget about it after 30 minutes of gameplay. I recommend this game for both strategy and TD fans.

37901318.review:
This is a strategy game where you focus on base-building, slowly expanding your territory to push back against a spreading ooze. It's great if you are more into the building and defense side of strategy games than the attacking or offense. 

There are a variety of units you can employ to take different approaches to each mission—some directly push back the ooze while some are more defensive. The campaign does a great job of changing up the missions so you have to try different strategies and use all the different units.

There is a campaign, hundreds of standalone maps (including challenge ones), and a map editor. It's a great game to play in short bursts (smaller maps take around 15-20 minutes to complete), but you can certainly spend a lot of hours on the game, if you'd like.

37873135.review:
Creeper World 3 isn't for everyone, but offers galaxies worth of "tower defense"-like content. Constantly pushing against your semi-mobile turret defenses is the grey goo cousin named Creeper. The objective is to hold ground against the Creeper until you can slowly push back and envelop the Creeper itself, destroying its spawning locations. It's a tug-of-war for your survival. Along the way or during the start you will be deciding which resource nodes to prioritize or upgrades to get. Most missions should be approached like puzzles, and pausing to plan or place buildings is a must for quicker times, but it can otherwise be played like an RTS.

The campaign provides tutorials and unlocks for the various defenses available, although the details of the story are forgettable. One common issue is that the difficulty spikes at a later mission. The soundtrack is some good, dramatic strategy music, but only lasts so long before getting repetitive.

The extras like the map editor, alpha sector (mini-games/rule changes), and scripting ('playing' as Creeper!?) are all much-appreciated icing on the cake if you enjoy the main portion.

If you have played the first Creeper World game then you know more or less what to expect in this refined and polished sequel.

I always sort of liked the idea of tower defence games but could never really get into them.  Creeper World is very much the exception, which takes the fundamental idea and runs with it, right off a cliff and on into the sunset.  With a few simple turrets you must hold back the oncoming tide long enough to build up your forces and push back.

The story mode was fun and there are a ridiculous number of extra maps to play.  If you enjoy it and fancy something similar, I also enjoyed Creeper World 2 which takes the basic idea and changes the axis so you are fighting up, or down, or even both instead.

37764165.review:
Flash版で旧作を遊んでいましたが、安定の面白さです。
古代祐三風なＢＧＭも入って、なかなかいい感じになっています。

日本語化はありませんが、元々ユニットの説明しか無いゲームで、
Flash攻略系のサイトに今でも情報がありますので、不自由は
していません。

以下、ユニットの簡単な説明です。

Collector：エネルギーをこれで集めて、建築や攻撃に使います。
また、電線を繋ぐ経路としても使います。

Relay：高速電線です。エネルギーは集められませんが、より遠くへ
より高速にエネルギーを送ります。

Reactor：エネルギー発電所です。建築が高く、エネルギーも微量
ですが、段差の激しいステージでは初動でいかにしてこれを敷き
つめるかが、勝負になります。

Ore Mine：敵を撃退する中和剤の元をここから掘ります。
アンチ・クリーパー（ＡＥ）と略されます。
離れ小島に安全地帯を作る為にボンバーで使うのが
一番効果的です。

Siphon：クリスタルに設置してエネルギー等を採取
しますが、枯渇します。
難易度が上がりすぎる為でしょう、殆ど登場しません。
むしろプレイヤーが作る意地悪ステージ向けです。

Shield：敵が入って来られないシールドを張ります。
エネルギーをガンガン使いますが、前線の安全地帯を
確保するのに便利です。

Terp：地形を盛り上げたり下げたりできるユニットです。
超便利で凸凹の激しい地形をなだらかにしたり、砲台の
設置や一時的な壁を作ったりします。
ただし、相応の時間とエネルギーが要ります。

Gruppy：エネルギーやＡＥを運ぶ輸送機です。
離れ小島に侵攻するには必須ですが、それ以外は必要
ありません。

Cannon：マシンガン
Mortar：榴弾
Strafeer：対地攻撃機。さほど強くない。
Bomber：ＡＣ（アンチ・クリーパー）爆弾の爆撃機。
Sprayer：ＡＣ散布砲台
Beam：敵の遠距離ミサイル（Ｓｐｏｒｅ）の迎撃砲台
Sniper：Runnerと呼ばれる生命体用狙撃砲台。
Nullifier：敵の本拠点やミッション攻撃目標の破壊に使う。
これを設置するのがこのゲームの目的。

Bertha：超強力な古代兵器砲台。でもリロードが遅い。
Forge：エネルギー採掘量や転送速度等のレベルアップを行う。
これを設置してエネルギーをパワーアップするまでが序盤の勝負。
その為に上記のReactorを敷き詰める。


ストーリーは、えらく長い間冬眠していた主人公が起こされて
みると、人間はもう絶滅しているといううんざり状態。
いっそ起こしてくれない方が楽だったかもしれないけど、
仕方無いので、覚えている知識でクリーパーを倒すことにする。

しかし何回もクリーパーは撃退した筈なのに、どうして
人類絶滅するまで追い込まれたのか。
どうもその原因はＡｒｃ　Ｅｔｅｒｎａｌという存在に
あるらしいので、それを探さないといけない。

という様な内容です。

若干の難点は、１ステージに一時間～二時間程度
かかってしまう事です。

37733257.review: Creeper World 3: Arc Eternal is really fun, loads of levels and user created worlds to challenge yourself in. 37730788.review:
The concept of the game is very simple. Some emitters spawn creeper, that slowly flows downwards following the shape of the map and destroying all your undefended structures. Your role is to fight back the creeper with defensive structures, generate enough energy to sustain the defense and finally push back the creeper and destroy the emitters.

An interesting aspect of the concept is that there is no "bad" AI trying to beat you, but the creeper is just following gravity. So you can precalculate exactly, what will happen, and plan your defense. You may try to secure high positions, defend strategically important point, rush to destroy emitters or try to generate a lot of energy and prioritize your defence, always wondering if your strategy was the best.

Otherwise this is a very conventional tower defense game, which makes it easyly accessible and after some time a bit boring. Nevertheless, after I was bored by the repetitiv game play, usually I come back 2-3 months later and have a lot of fun again. So on the long term this game is a great investment and has to be valued for a great game concept.

36176581.review:
Creeper world 3: Arc Eternal is a vast improvement on the series as a whole. It features the same formula as the first, with the good elements of the second and improves upon both of them to create a unique formula of its own which dare I say is better in almost every way! 

The gameplay is lit, it's got tons of variety, it's got unique 'wind' mechanics which can make the creeper unpredictable, it's got a lot of units for every situatuation, it's got multiple "command nodes" which can let you deploy a multitude of strategies, it's got superweapons too! But I'll let you see those for yourself!

Creeper world three takes the cake in how it has a very fun map editor; I have just as much fun playing my maps as I do making them! It has its own scripting language, and you can learn it to make more advanced maps like you see in the story but otherwise it's very easy to make a basic map.

This isn't even the biggest winner in my book. When I said variety, oh boy did I mean variety. The creeper is smarter, faster, thicker, it takes over and uses technology against you, the maps are bigger, everything is better. It's hard to put it to words for me, specifically. The time I've spent in this game is time I don't regret. Oh, did I mention the soundtrack? It's great. 

I'll not even bother adding the pros or cons, this game is great all around. If I had to name one con, it's that it's too damn big for a completionist like me! >: I still haven't beaten the side maps! :c I'm sorry, I'm biased. I really, really like this game. Buy it! You won't regret it if you need something to waste time! I swear!

35931833.review:
What an amazing game! This is a mix of real-time strategy, tower defense and liquid physics. It is an excellent example how you don't need lifelike 3D graphics, a great story or a bombastic sountrack - as long as the gameplay is rock solid like here. After 200+ hours not a single negative quality comes to my mind. It's still as much fun as when I started and I still find myself challenged by some maps.

The amount of content is truly mind-boggling. I've honestly just scratched the surface. There are thousands of pre-made maps and an infinite amount of randomly generated and community-made maps. There's everything from easy 5min runs you can sleep-walk through to 5-hour-long battles where you always find yourself on the brink of extinction and claw for inches against overwhelming amounts of creeper. If you ever tire of the gameplay - there's dozens of achievements to chase and some really clever community maps to play, that take advantage of the scripting capability. And every single map has an online leader-board if you are looking for competition.

I've never encountered a bug or technical problem. All the settings, from hotkeys to color schemes are customizable. The game loads and runs extremely fast, even on my rather anemic computer. You can play everything at your pace, since you can pause or save/quit at any moment, so even multi-front battles are quite doable. The base mechanics are simple, there's about two dozen buildings at most, but there's still a lot of different play-styles and unit preferences, which are all pretty viable.

If you are at all interested in strategy or tower defense this is a must-buy! But if you are still hesitant - check out the demo from the developer's website or play the old Creeper World flash game.

35703250.review:
Creeper World used to be an old favorite of mine, back when it was a small flash game on Kongregate or some other gaming website. Imagine my surprise when I saw it on steam....and a third edition, no less! Needless to say, the game has come very far since its flash days. I think it may even still be a flash game. Regardless, this version has so much content to offer, it is ridiculous. You start the story with a few towers and have to fight the Creeper, which is basically a fluid that flows down different terrain levels. You can collect energy in the early levels, which lets your command node send out packets of ammo and construction to build things or destroy Creeper. Later, you unlock Anticreeper which uses the same mechanics as Creeper, but it helps you out instead! Each level unlocks more towers and more areas of the game, such as the super-hard Alpha Sector and player-made maps on the DMD(Dial Map Device). Play any number of thousands of missions provided for you after you beat the story (not the best, admittedly, but for this type of game, great). Get bored of that? Make your own maps to grind achievements on or challenge what you thought was possible! Hate the colour purple or light blue? Change the colours of both Anticreeper and Creeper to suit your eyes. Simply a unique game that will provide hours of enjoyment for tower defense fans.

If I only had one complaint, it would be that after you initially hold off the Creeper and get yourself set up collecting energy, you can always win and steamroll over the Creeper. It has no AI so there is nothing that will surprise you after you beat the storymode. That being said, the amount of different towers and ways to win each level are great to provide some variety instead of simply using a blaster and mortar each time.

9/10

I find that part of gameplay the most enjoyable, being a puzzle fanatic. The feeling of satisfaction you get after an hour of patiently creeping your way further into Creeper territory until you've destroyed all emitters... there's nothing like it.

34822172.review:
Greetings as always!  So, I have a guilty pleasure and that is these ‘creeper’ games and today I’m reviewing Creeper World 3:  Arc Eternal.  If any of you have been following my reviews you may find this odd as it is an older game from my first experience of this series:  Particle Fleet (made by the same developer) but the honest reason is I didn’t know this game type even existed until Particle Fleet and I still wasn’t sold that this wasn’t a one hit wonder so I cautiously bought the game you see now.

I’m doing what:  This game is an odd mesh of genre’s:  Part tower defense, part base builder but all real time strategy when it comes down to it.  However, you aren’t going to see many controllable units (aside from fighters / bombers) and even those you really aren’t micro-managing as they are told to strike an area and generally left alone (nothing in the game can actually damage them).  Your first encounter with this may leave you with a “That’s it?” kind of thought but as you keep playing you will find the complexity comes from the buildings themselves and not the core game (as all great strategy games have).

Loud Noises:   Like the later game of the genre (the above Particle Fleet) the music is very good, though I do tend to turn it off after several hours of playing it.  My friends have an overwhelming annoyance with the cannon sounds…not sure why.  To be fair, the gun sounds can be obnoxious from an onlooker’s perspective.  I just don’t mind all that much as I’m usually listening to something else.  In addition the graphics are very simple; but I’m glad they are as the game is about the gameplay not the graphics or particle effects or really even the sounds (though, again, the music is really good).

Multitasking:  One of the amazing things about this game is the ‘casual’ nature of the gameplay itself with the possibility of improvement to a competitive level.  That sounded a bit word-salad but what I mean is the game isn’t really ‘hard’ but more of a challenge that can be relaxing like a brain teaser and I found myself using this game as a wind down at the end of a night or after work along with watching a movie or podcast; nothing too intense.  Now, if you are trying for the leader boards then get ready to white knuckle because there is some serious optimization to be had.  In the end, however, I am happy with my slow paced game for the purpose I’ve set for it.

Overall, I make no qualms in that this game is a guilty pleasure of mine.  This game is not for everyone; it can be a bit slow paced (or fast depending on you).  I’d earnestly recommend that everyone gives this a try, especially if you are a management, strategy or puzzle fan.  I also have to mention that there appears to be a near endless amount of content.  I actually forced myself to uninstall this game as I was playing it instead of moving on to other games in my library.  At worse, wait for a sale as the game does get pretty cheap during those.  As always, regardless of your decision I hope you enjoy your gaming!

34482938.review:
I'm writing a negative review not because I didn't enjoy the game, I really did, but I want to highlight my criticisms and feel this is the best way to go about it.

Cons:
-The enemy is non-reactive, having no ai of its own.
Now, this IS NOT a bad thing, but it creates problems when coupled with other design decisions.
-Every level, is winable. This means that, once you know what's going on, if you can build a stable base in the beginning, you have already won the map. Victory is inevitable so long as you dont over-extend yourself. This KILLS any real thought of strategy once new elements stop being introduced or combined in new ways.
-The real question is how QUICKLY you can win, which means the only true challenge you'll face is when a level has a time limit of some kind or has a component within it that requires fast progression.
This ALSO isn't necessarily a bad thing. There's a sort of catharsis to this game's war of attrition, even if the deck is decidedly stacked in your favor
-The game DOES have scripted sequences where unexpected changes occur, changing the map and, likely, ruining your immediate plans and requiring a new strategy. But they arent used to their fullest potential and rarely occur if at all.

What I was looking for:
This game is very good for what it is. (it is the THIRD game in a series of similar games after all. Lots of refining has happened). That said, once its novelty passed for me, I just couldnt stay interested, even WITH user generated contet.
-Once I realized that victory is basically inevitable in ANY situation without a timer and learned how to deal with any situation a map could throw at me, I lost interest.
-What I REALLY want from this game, that it CANNOT deliver on due to its own systems and design, is a war of attrition decidedly in the enemy's favor. Where DEFEAT is inevitable, but preventable and the only question is how long you can survive.
-The strategies you have at your disposal are not varied enough to make this kind of play truly interesting. The game is set up so that, outside of timing and basic idea, you are constantly just improving on your initial strategy adding more and more units as you build your base.
--Initial decisions have virtually NO bearing on later strategies. Outside of success or failure, the strategy you start with has no bearing on whether you'll be successful in later parts of the level. I would have LOVED a "path less traveled" sort of design where one decision means you CAN'T have somthing else down the road.

So ya, it's a good game, worth the buy, but it didn't really scratch the particular itch I had.

- clever spin on tower defence games

Cons:
- dialogues at the start of each level are confusing in explaining tech and sometimes confusing about what exactly they want you to do.  It would have been better to drop the story and just give simple explanations or give a simple summary with optional story.
- no way of controlling difficulty - as new tech is explained quite poorly and as I am a casual player (and not so intelligent one) when I get to a new level I regularly have to exit, go to youtube to work out how to play it (and how to use new tech) and then attempt that strategy.   I would like to have been able to reduce the difficulty a little so I could try to figure it out myself without going elsewhere.  A simple slider to reduce the speed of the advance of the creeper would do this.  

I like strategy games.  I like tower defence games.  I love the concept behind this.  But the difficulty takes the fun out of it for me.

34031969.review:
quick review.

Absolute best tower defence game in the world. Hands down. This is coming from someone who hates tower defence.

8 utility buildings, 8 towers, and 3 "titan class" structures are a perfect amount of options for the player to fight with.

None of the structures are useless or unimportant as they all serve you differently with ups and downs to each.

Instead of individual enemies, you're fighting an ever increasing amount of goo. This in itself makes the game super unique compared to any game on the market, let alone any tower defence game.

Watching your front line of turrets holding off the wave of goo is satisfying.

Every single tower and certain utility buildings can be relocated, albeit slowly.

Campaign is great. Super diverse variety of levels.

Managing and sending recourses to the front lines from your command hub is also satisfying.

So many different strats you could come up with in this game.

Infinitely varied scenario generator.

Custom community lvls.

Super cool community modified levels where you get to play as the goo!!!

Music is awesome but repetitive and limited.

Art style isn't exactly my cup of tea, it being really colourful with all the towers looking very "plasticy" considering the depressing era that the galaxy is under.

In the end; highly, highly recommended.

34023889.review: Really great game, with an interesting story and awesome gameplay.

33928633.review:
J'ai joué à Creeper World. J'ai beaucoup aimé.
J'ai joué à Creeper World 2. J'ai beaucoup aimé.
J'ai joué à Creeper World 3 avec une légère appréhension... et j'ai fait un trait sur l'expression "jamais deux sans trois".

C'est comme le Canada Dry. Il a la couleur, l'aspect, l'odeur d'un bon jeu... mais il faudrait m'expliquer à quel moment le concepteur des deux premiers volets a perdu la notion de dosage de difficulté.
Probablement à cause des nombreuses cartes réalisées par la communauté des fans pour Creeper Worlds 2, dont certaines sont à peine réalisables sans cheater et sans profiter d'un bug du jeu.

Bref, entre l'introduction d'une technologie à la limite de l'inutilité (les boucliers : la carte où ils apparaissent est bien plus facile à finir sans les utiliser, tellement leur consommation d'énergie est abusée par rapport à leur puissance) et les deux dernières cartes de la campagne qui vous mettent un chronomètre hyper-court alors que toutes les autres cartes qui ont précédé n'en ont pas, franchement, ça me fait désinstaller. Probablement définitivement. Alors que les deux premiers volets sont toujours installés sur ma machine.

Appelez-moi "mauvais joueur" si ça vous amuse... je me suis accroché sur Creeper World et Creeper World 2 car à chaque nouvelle tentative, j'avançais un peu plus.
Ici, on n'a même pas le temps de comprendre pourquoi on perd, juste le temps de voir du creeper qui vient de nulle part (le niveau des boucliers dont je parle ci-dessus, ce qui augmente encore leur inutilité) ou voir un "méchant" qui vous plante des émetteurs de creeper au sommet des murs et/ou au milieu de votre réseau (dernier niveau).

Personnellement, ça me gave de devoir regarder des vidéos pour voir comment on passe un niveau... surtout dans un jeu qui est supposé laisser plusieurs stratégies possibles.

Si je n'avais pas joué aux deux premiers volets, j'aurais mis une évaluation positive pour l'originalité du concept et pour encourager un concepteur indépendant.
Mais comme, on a juste un recyclage des deux précédents jeux, c'est rapé pour l'originalité et je n'ai pas envie d'encourager la paresse.

33769835.review:
Поглядев, видимо, на вторую часть, Knuckle Cracker поняли, что именно пошло не так. И вернулись обратно к схеме первой части. Только теперь из Периметра было утащено вообще всё, что только можно, учитывая, разумеется, прежнюю направленность "игра против агрессивной среды, а не против разумного противника". Ну, ладно, кроме 3Д-графики и подвижных отрядов. Но пушки (в том числе и дальнобойные мега-пушки), зенитные батареи (в противовес наземным), ракеты, щиты, аккумуляторы и даже терраформинг - всё это здесь есть. 

Криперы тоже поднялись на новый уровень. Кроме прежних наземных "затапливающих" криперов и воздушных "бомбардировщиков", появилась туча новых видов - от "пауков", заплетающих всё неуязвимой паутиной и супер-генераторов, до вырубающих щиты "жуков" и всё разрушающих "сборщиков".

Сюжет вернулся к первой части - но под другим соусом. Точно так же мы линейно движемся от системы к системе, уничтожая криперов - но на этот раз мы их действительно уничтожаем, без неприятных сюрпризов и дурацких ограниченных миссий...

...Ну, почти. Самая последняя миссия в сюжете таки на время. И таки я фатально не успеваю её сделать - самую капельку, процентов на 20 бы мне быть быстрее... Это несколько омрачает удовольствие от игры. Но в целом - очень хорошо. И к этой миссии я, надеюсь, ещё вернусь.

В бонусных материалах - полубесконечная вселенная с процедурными планетами, которые можно освобождать сколько вашей душе угодно. Без неприятных ограничений по времени, я надеюсь.

Рекомендую.

33736565.review:
遥かな未来、敵対的な古代種族Lokiの開発したCreeperと呼ばれるナノマシン兵器があらゆる文明を破棄すべく転移空間を越えて押し寄せ、宇宙全体を滅亡の危機に陥れていた。最初の戦いにおいて、人類の最後の生き残りを集めPlatiusと呼ばれる謎めいた人物の助けを受けながらCreeperを打ち破った伝説的司令官たる主人公Skarsgardはその後に起きた二度目の戦争の終わりに再びPlatiusに導かれ姿を消す。
・・・そして50億年後。宇宙船の中で冷凍睡眠から目覚めた主人公を迎えたのは船の補助AIであるLiaと想像を絶する時間のうちにCreeperによって破壊し尽くされ変化した世界の名残だけだった。
なぜ自分がこの時代に送られたのか？世界が破滅する前に目覚めそれを守るべきではなかったのか？PlatiusそしてLokiの目的とは一体？数え切れない疑問を抱えたまま宇宙最後の人類となった彼はそれらの謎を追って今一度Creeperとの最終決戦に挑む・・・


全方位から押し寄せる液状の敵を押し返しながらエネルギー供給と火力を確保し、最終的に各種のスポーンを破壊してマップを支配する非常に独特なRTS。現在３Dを取り入れたCW4が開発中だそうだ！
敵が液状なだけあって他のゲームに無い密度の高いプレイ感が特徴なのだがなにせ他にこのような敵をメインに据えたゲームはないので実際にプレイしてみなくてはいまいちピンとこないかもしれない。とりあえずシリーズのベスト版とも言える本作を買ってしまうか公式の無料版を試してみるといいだろう

残念ながら有志のMODでもない限り日本語化のあてはなさそうなのだが日本語での攻略情報はそれなりに見つかるのでそちらも参照されたし。

33734302.review:
[*]Creeper World 3 est un Tower Defense assez stratégique qui prend place dans un futur lointain. Vous êtes dans la peau de l'Admiral Abraxis, et votre but est d'éliminer le creeper pour vous frayer un chemin dans l'univers.
[*]Ce Tower Defense sort du lot grace à l'élément qui revient dans chaque opus et qui donne son nom  au jeu : le creeper.
[*]Le creeper est une matière vivante semi-liquide toxique pour toutes formes de vie, votre objectif est de construire autant de batiments que possible pour vous former un chemin jusqu'aux emmiter et enfin vous en débarasser.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Les parties de Creeper World 3 ont plusieurs modes de jeu mais je vais vous parler du plus basique, à l'aide de vos modules de commandes, vous devez vous préparez à vous protéger face au creeper en prenant en compte plusieurs facteurs :
[*] vous devez essayer d'avoir assez de ressources énergétiques.
[*] vous devez essayer d'économiser vos mineraies.
[*] vous devez gagner aussi rapidement que possible.

Sachez que si une de ces règles n'est pas assez respecter vous risquerez au mieux de perdre du terrain, et au pire de perdre la partie.
Et si vous arrivez à trouvez une faille durant la partie, vous devez récupérer du terrain jusqu'aux emmiters et enfin les éliminers.
Vous pourrez trouver sur votre chemin des ressources en tout genre et des technologies pour vous venir en aide contre le creeper.

[h1]Scénario, graphisme et bande-son[/h1]

Le scénario de Creeper World 3 est étonnament pofiné. Dans chaque opus de Creeper World, on s'attend à ce qu'il ne soit plus possible qu'il y ai de suite car l'histoire est toujours captivante et est toujours terminer de façon à ne pas laisser les joueurs sur leur faims. Le scénario de Creeper World 3 comprend peu de personnages, mais est toujours captivante comme dans la chaque opus ( surtout vers la fin du jeu mais no spoil). :)

Au niveau du son je m'attendais à ce que cela soit assez axceptionnel et je n'ai pas été déçu, le son est excellent, l'ambiance n'est pas stressante, on ne se lasse pas d'écouter les musiques du jeu.

Niveau graphisme le jeu n'est pas très exigeant. Tout est simpliste  : on a pas besoin d'avoir 'dun tower défense qui en jette plein les yeux, le jeu ne vous piquerat pas les yeux (même si je ne vois pas pourquoi tout le monde critique les graphismes car je suis un habitué des jeux de Knuckles Cracker), mais en plus on oublie vite les graphismes du jeu une fois que l'on est à fond dedans.

*Je tiens à souligner que si vous vous trouvez sur une carte gigantesque et/ou que la quantité de creeper deviens importante, le jeu risque de ramer ce qui est normal si vous n'avez pas un PC normal.

[h1]Qu'est-ce qu'il y a de nouveaux par rapport aux anciens opus ?[/h1]

Creeper World 3 est un mélange de Creeper World 2 et Creeper World. On y retrouve tout les éléments de Creeper World 2 avec les éléments de Creeper World, mais avec le mode de jeu de Creeper World en vue de dessus. Cela permet aux plus fidèles de la licence de retrouver tout les éléments qu'ils appréciaient, dans le mode de jeu le plus aimer des joueurs.

On compte comme nouveaux éléments :
[*]Le retour du Thor
[*]Les titans
[*]Les modules de commandes
[*]Le niveau de sol "0" (le vide)
[*]De nouveaux batiments
[*]Les digitalis
[*]Les runners
[*]De nouvelles unités
[*]La forge
[*]Le CRPL (Je vais y revenir)

Contrairement aux anciens Creeper World, jamais les joueurs n'avaient eux accès à 3 QG, et en plus les QG ne se détruisent pas lorsqu'ils sont atteins par le creeper mais simplement mis temporairement hors-service ce qui est un énorme point positif sur le jeu. Le digitalis permet d'influencer le déplacement du creeper si celui-ci est dominer par le creeper, mais il permet également de dire aux runners ou ils doivent se déplacer. Les runners sont des variantes de drones de Creeper world 2, encore un point positif pour ce jeu.

[h1]Mode éditeur[/h1]

Les modes éditeurs de Creeper World ont toujours été connus pour être facile d'utilisation et de compréhention. Tout types de joueurs est capable de créer une carte unique facilement et rapidement. Les cartes de Creeper World 3 peuvent atteindre une taille maximal de 256 sur 256 ce qui est exceptionnellement grand pour ce jeu, encore un point positif pour Creeper World 3. Mais ce qui est la base de la céation de cartes uniques dans Creeper World 3 est sans doute le [b]CRPL[/b].
Le CRPL est en temps normal un langage informatique, mais le développeur de Creeper World 3 a décider de le mettre à disposition des joueurs pour leur permettre de créer des niveaux exceptionnelles. Et contrairement à ce que l'on peut croire, créer un niveau à partir de language informatique n'est pas difficile ! Le site de knuckle Cracker permet aux joueurs de d'apprendre à gérer le CRPL quelque soit leur expérience avec ce language. D'après ma connaissance, Creeper World 3 est le seul Tower Defense qui met du language informatique à disposition de ses utilisateurs. Encore un point à ne pas négliger.
De plus, on apprend grace au développeur du jeu que l'on peut se servir de toutes les cartes de Creeper World 3 via le fichier qui est dédier au jeu pour s'en servir en mode éditeur ! Génial ! :)

[h1]Nouveaux modes de jeu[/h1]

Cela à un rapport avec le CRPL, mais je vais simplement citer ces modes qui sont ceux qui pourraient prendre le plus de votre temps dans le jeu :
[*] Puzzle (Il y en a plusieurs types)
[*] Sleeper (meilleur mode de jeu du jeu selon moi)
[*] Particle
[*] PAC (Mode de jeu qui vous ferat jouer à la place du creeper)
[*] Votre mode de jeu (Il est possible grace au CRPL de créer VOTRE mode de jeu)

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Je pense que pour le moment, Creeper World 3 est le meilleur Creeper World jamais sortie, sa durer de vie n'est même pas mesurable ce qui montre que c'est un excellent jeu, je ne vais pas faire un discours pour décrire à nouveau le jeu, je donne la note de 20/20 pour toutes les améliorations et nouveautés apportées dans le jeu, Jeu addictif, venez nombreux :)

33673485.review: It's a fun mechanic, and sometimes a fun game, but there are things I really don't like about it. It feels too much like an amateurly produced indie game, even though really the game is solidly designed. Challenge has little to do with survival -- it's more like, if you screw up, you're going to spend another half an hour building something that actually works. And the mechanics of unlocked tech are often poorly explained, leading to exactly the kind of confusion that causes you to screw up. Since tech is unlocked in almost every mission, as far as I've played, the result is a somewhat frustrating experience. To be clear, I don't think this is the developer's fault -- the game is solidly put together, it's just that its mechanic tends to overwhelm and destroy when you make a mistake. I'd recommend it if you're looking for inspiration in your own game design projects -- but not so much if you just feel like playing it.

33628769.review:
ぱっと見ではわかりにくいゲームだと思いますが、大変よくできたタワーディフェンス系のゲームです。

敵は液状で、基本的には基地(巣？〕から無限にわいてきます。水と同じく高いところから低い所へ流れる性質で、低地に到達すると溜まっていきます。
自然消滅しないので何もせずに放置しておくとマップ一杯に溜まり続け、プレイヤーのベースが浸ってしまい破壊されるとゲームオーバーとなります。
プレイヤーはこの液状の物体が自分のベースまで到達しないように、砲台などで攻撃して押し返しながら土地を確保し、確保した土地からリソースを回収し、回収施設の防衛と範囲の拡張を行いながら少しずつ敵の基地に近付いていき、敵基地破壊専用のタワーを建造し、マップ内にある全ての敵基地を破壊できればステージクリアとなります。
ステージを進めていくと徐々に建造できるものが増えていき、戦術の幅も広がっていきます。
マップによって存在することがある古代遺跡的な建造物を利用することで、さらに戦いを有利に進めることができる場合もあります。
逆に敵に有利な施設や地形がある場合もあり、対応を迫られるためなかなか忙しいです。
しかしポーズしてゆっくり考えることもできるので、忙しい操作や思考が苦手な筆者でも楽しむことができました。

プレイヤーによって様々な攻略の仕方があるゲームだと思います。クリアしてみてから、ああしたらもっと早くクリアできるのではないかと思いつき、もう一度同じステージをプレイしてみたり、自分なりに最適化していく作業が楽しかったりします。

ちょっと見た目が地味で、ムービーからでは面白さが伝わりにくいゲームではないかと思ったので、稚拙ながらレビューさせていただきました。


2017.11.23編集
2017STEAMアワード"言語に絶するで賞"にノミネートさせていただきました。
タワーディフェンスと呼んでいいのか何とも言いがたいシステムのせいか、このゲームが最初に想起されました。
ちなみに"言語に絶するで賞"はこんな賞です。以下原文のコピペです。
『このゲームはいわば... あえて言うとよく似たゲームは... イメージとしては... いや、もう説明は無理です。とにかくプレイしてください。』

33532647.review: Its very fun and addicting. It's kinda like an "offensive tower-defence". You build towers that give u energy and send packets of energy to build more energy towers and/or turrets. The goal is to get rid of all of the enemy structures producing "creeper". The turrets can move slowly to another location if u need them to. You have to defend your base while also pushing forward towards the enemy structures. There is a land elevation mechanic that is also very important. The creeper flows down hills easily, and only some turrets can aim up the hills. There is a random level generator and a level editor and sharing system, so its basically infinite replayability. If you like tower-defence games, you will probably love this game.

This is a game I often keep going back to.
This is a game where you can use your towers to both defend yourself and drive back the enemy.
The aim of the game is to clear the enemy (creeper) out so you can destroy eliminate the enemy strong points.
The game is both simple and complex in that there is a limted range of units but each map is unique has a variety of resource points and terrain that can limit the location of the starting points.
Often the goal is can you build your base and defences and upgrade them so that you can defeat the creeper when it reaches you!!!!

Be prepared, this game can suck you in and make time disappear.

32858189.review:
¡Muy recomendable! A pesar de que tecnicamente cuenta como tower defense no tiene nada que ver con ese género sobreexplotado que tiene miles de juegos gratuitos. En este juego las torretas no se ponen en toscas casillas predeterminadas, si no que el mapa está dividido en una rejilla de casillas pequeñas donde puedes elegir la posicion de las torretas con total libertad salvo en algunos niveles, que ocurren en planetas destruidos rollo Alderaan.

Hay un montón de estructuras, algunas ofensivas y otras defensivas, que se van desbloqueando poco a poco. Cada una de ellas es suficientemente unica para que merezca la pena, aunque solo unas pocas son imprescindibles, siempre sientes que te conviene usarlas todas siempre que puedas.

El enemigo tampoco es convencional; se trata de una baba azul (llamada el creeper) que se comporta como un fluido viscoso. Tan pronto como es generado por los emisores se extiende tanto como puede a lo ancho, normalmente asta llegar a una zona a menos altura (los mapas estan divididos en 12 capas de altura, la capa 0 es el vacío, y la capa 11 está reservada para el creeper y no se puede construir en ella) en la que cae a la capa inferior, la cual sigue  cubriendo asta desbordarse. Debido a esta mecanica la mejor estrategia es empezar a construir tu base en una zona elevada si el mapa lo permite, ya que el creeper, por naturaleza, cubrirá los valles primero.

Todo esto significa que a diferencia de los tower defense tradicionales, el enemigo no sigue una ruta especifica, sino que se expande en todas las direcciones posibles poco a poco.

Además, la forma de construir torretas también es distinta. Al empezar un nivel debes colocar un modulo de comando en el mapa (es más o menos el doble de grande que la malloria de estructuras), y alrededor suyo debes empezar a construir colectores que te alludarán a producir energía, que se usa para construir y dar municion a las estructuras. Las estructuras se conectan entre sí si estan cerca, lo que también significa que tienes que expandir tu base poco a poco o tus estructuras no recibirán suministros.

Y si no estás convencido, hay precuelas del juego que puedes jugar gratis online, tú busca creeper world user space, o creeper world evermore en google, y te saldrán entre las primeras opciones. Ya de por si estas versiones son buenas, pero esta versión de pago es incluso mejor, con mejores mapas, más tipos de enemigos, más armas, la capacidad de terraformar el mapa...

Lo único a tener en cuenta, no probeis creeper world 2, porque esta version es completamente diferente al creeper world 1, evermore, user space, y 3. No es que sea malo, es solo que el gameplay es totalmente distinto y no se debería tomar en cuenta a la hora de comprar este.

32628851.review:
Я начала своё знакомство с серией этих игр ещё когда только-только вышла первая часть. Я заиграла её до дыр, помню как запускала на старом ноуте 2002 года выпуска. Сколько восторга и радости я получала проходя снова и снова все эти миссии. Я регулярно мониторила сеть на наличие информации о второй части, каждый день. И я дождась. Вторая часть сильно отличалась от первой, но и она мне сразу полюбилась, я проходила её как и первую - снова и снова. Каждый раз я читала эти диалоги, эту историю, каждый раз я всё переживала словно впервые. А затем...вышла третья часть.
Эта игра невероятна. Я наиграла в неё 400 с лишним часов пока могла (теперь возможности временно нет, по техническим причинам), я прошла историю, открыла все концовки (как же я плакала в одной из них). Сначала я начала гнаться за ачивками (это был вызов, они давались непросто, но я люблю хороший вызов), а потом я расслабилась и просто играла в своё удовольствие.
Просто запустите эту игру один раз, выполните одно задание и я гарантирую, что эта игра навсегда поселится в вашем сердце. 
Knuckle Cracker, спасибо вам <3
Моя оценка: 11 командных центров из 10.

32498434.review:
[h1]This tower defense game has a innovative enemy type you are fighting against and very strategic gameplay. Most of the praise it gets is well deserved. However, despite me typically enjoying tower defense games, Creeper World 3: Arc Eternal grew very monotonous. After some time, almost every map felt and played the same.[/h1]

The gameplay feels novel in the first few hours with a very interesting, new enemy. You are fighting against a physically more or less correctly behaving liquid that never stops flowing until you destroy its source and will slowly, but surely drown you otherwise. I have played around 8 hours now. The first ones were exhilarating with new towers types being slowly introduced. However, after all new towers have been shown to you, the novely quickly wears off. Every map plays more or less the same. Even though I really enjoy turtling in strategy games, here it becomes very repetitive and tedious.

There are hundreds of maps to play, but with the story being extremely forgettable, there is no incentive for me to keep playing this game. This is a good game, no doubt. 
For me personally, Creeper World III didn't draw me in as much as Defense Grid, Kingdom Rush or Defender's Quest.

The music is appropriate, but with only six tracks gets repetive very fast.

2017/06/16 미루고 미루던 메인 스토리 클리어, 도전과제 : 54/139
평가 : 9/10 추천 구매가 : 정가!
Knuckle Crackert사의 실시간 전략 시뮬레이션 게임 Creeper World의 세 번째 판입니다. 이 회사는 버전이 늘어나면 늘어날 수록 게임이 재미있어지네요. 기본적으로는 Creep을 열심히 부수고 그 Creep 나오는 곳도 부수고 뭐 이것저것 다 하는 게임입니다. 메인 스토리 자체 캠페인은 약 20여개 정도 있던 걸로 기억합니다만, 이 게임은 거기서 끝이 아니라 추가적으로 더 컨텐츠를 제공한다는 점이 정가여도 망설임 없이 구매하게 만드는 거 같습니다. 각 미션마다 보통 40분~1시간 정도 걸리는 것 같습니다. 하던 도중 저장도 가능한 만큼 큰 부담이 있지는 않습니다. 정 구매가 망설여 지신다면, 이 게임의 옛날 버전(Creeper world 1)의 플래시 버전이 있는데 그 쪽을 해보는 것도 좋은 것 같습니다. 또한, 이 회사의 다른 작품인 Particle Fleet도 이쪽 게임을 좋아한다면 정말 취향에 맞는 좋은 게임일 것입니다.

+ 스토리 클리어하고 나오는 알파 섹터에 재밌는 게 많네요 ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
이걸로 퀴즈 프로그램을 만들다니 ㅋㅋㅋㅋ

32181149.review:
[h1]Стратегия с безупречной механикой[/h1]
С первого взгляда очень простая и примитивная игра, которая выросла из игры на экшен флеше, но глубокая стратегия с мощным менеджментом ресурсов и окружающего пространства. Грубо говоря на каждой карте игрок должен победить постоянно появляющуюся волну синей массы, которая нарастает слоями, "стекает" на позиции игрока, заполняет собой рвы и ямы, "переливается" через стены и уничтожает все все все. Игроку необходимо принять позиционный бой с управлением ресурсов, постоянной подпиткой орудий энергией, выделением энергии на строительство и продвижение вглубь вражеской волны. Очень много миссий, пользовательские карты и многое другое. Тот случай когда простота игры не говори о том что она глупая.

29659854.review:
First off let me tell you that I love this games concept.  the turret deffense along with leaderboards and other things make for a rather interesting game.

some key things I have to dissagree with on the concepts.
1) leaderboards are broken.  how can you beat a level in less than a min.  it takes more time for your orbitals to land than some of these people took to beat the levels.  I call foul.
2) Campaign - It seems choppy at best, and broken as worst.  sure I was able to beat it.  but most of the items you have at your disposal and the fact that even two ore harvesters cannot support one single ore spitter for continuious fire is sad.  then there are the titans.  Useless in ever case.  even on the missions you may want them they take too long to fire, the creep comes back too fast even on 1x speed to do anything tactical with them, and the last one is only for the end mission, you don't even get to use it on special missions after you unlock it.

now for the reason that this game is great!
1) it has user/mod like interface.  looks to me (haven't finnished all bonus sectors yet) that you get to make and share with other players in these maps.  maybe they just modify/test them first to make sure you don't screw over the comunity, but this is a rather interesting idea.
2) the story is actually decent.  Sure it may seem obvious at times, and others down right boring.  However, if you decide to read it all (storyline) you get an interesting story.  one worth talking about to friends and family.  Just like when you read a good book, or new article.
3) Replayability - Sure the leaderboards are broken, but you can still post your times and strive to improve them, come up with new and interesting ideas on how to beat the levels, and even strive to limit yourself in ways not ment (like only cannons and solor collectors)

In the end this game is worth picking up, yet I would think nothing more than $10 for the short campaign limit, but the extra sectors do make up for the loss in gameplay.  Just wish they had some kind of RPG element sector where you gather things/currency and use them to improve/unlock different items to use in the next mission (like if you could boost yourself with a starting ammount of energy or something)  of course this would destroy the leaderboards in that sector, but that would be something like score rather than just time (like -points per sec and +points for builds and kills.  Also give you a point handycap for bonuses, and a point bonus for detriments)

Anyways if you like Tower Defense or base building you may want to check this game out.

28576170.review: Creeper World 3 manages to scratch an interesting itch, its kind of the perfect balance of tower defense and territory control. 28569403.review:
A true indie gem.  The tags say this is a tower defense game, but it is really it's own thing.  I suppose tower defense is the closest thing to what it is but it is a bit misleading.

So what it is?  The premise is you have to fight back the creeper, which behaves pretty much like water pouring out of a spout (or more than one most of the time).  It slowly spreads from it's source, and is stopped by walls and higher ground until it fills up the area below and reaches the correct height.  To fight this, you build cannons, mortors, flying craft, anti-creeper producers (your beneficial creeper than cancels out the other creeper) and a few other weapons.  These are your "towers" but they are all mobile and can be placed anywhere they fit.  To support them you need to produce energy, which comes from nodes that cover the ground and reactors.  The nodes link up to others and need to link back to your base to produce energy and supply your troops.  Reactors don't need any ground to cover and produce more.  Troops out of supply will soon use up there reserves and will no longer be able to use their abilities.

So for gameplay you will slowly spread out over the map, extenting your network and fighting back the creeper until you reach the sources and take them out with special weapons.  That's the basics but there is more.  There is a scripting language for the maps that lets them bend the rules.  There is one, non-story level where you control a man through a maze who shoots and finds keys for instance.  To top it all off, there are literally thousands of maps (most likely, I didn't count).  The main story is only a very small part of the game.  After completing parts of it other areas open up, which are basically user created maps, beta testing maps and challenging maps.  If you like the game enough you could spend thousands of hours on it, I'm sure.  I was content with just the main story and a few other maps though.

If this looks at all interesting to you, do yourself a favor and pick it up.  It isn't even expensive.

28550408.review:
Creeper World Three is a cute little tower defense/ base building strategy game.

It's a solid, albiet unrevolutionary, game in the genre.  If you like tower defense games and base building this is a great choice for you.  If you don't, you can pass this out.

I just love this game so much, it fills in the gaps and holes other games left in me by being incomplete or bad.
Creeper World 3 is a base building tower defense with deep strategy and extra mechanics to keep things interesting. 
You, the player, Vs. The creeper - A growing, organic, hive fluid that spreads across terrain consumning all in it's path.

Cannons, mortars, snipers, big berthas and more!! 
Are all at your disposal to keep back, and annhilate the creeper and it's tools!!

Every mission is different, every map is unique, and there are thousands if not millions of player created maps in addition to the tutorial, campaign, and different sectors. 

If you enjoy tower defense, a bit of micromanagement, strategy, an adaptive enemy, and so much content that you'll be happy for weeks, hell, even if you enjoy factorio, you'll probably enjoy this game just as much as me. It isn't gorgeous, but it's good enough.  The gameplay is what it's about anyway.  After each map I have to snap out of a pleasant daze - the game's tempo and sounds keep me completely absorbed in the action.

28094239.review:
[h1]Непонятно[/h1]
На первый взгляд, игра очень странная, и что в ней происходит - непонятно. Непонятно даже после просмотра видео в магазине Steam. А происходит вот что. Мы строим базу, которая представляет из себя неориентированный граф с произвольным расположением узлов, по граням которого перемещаются снаряды, ресурсы и электроэнергия.

[h1]Кто враг?[/h1]
Противник больше всего напоминает жидкость, эта жидкость постоянно испускается из одного или нескольких источников, и медленно затапливает карту. Жидкость зовут The Creeper, и она играет роль Жнецов из Mass Effect, то есть на протяжении биллионов лет Creeper приходит и уничтожает человеческую цивилизацию, и на момент игры этот цикл выполнился уже сотни раз (т.е. цивилизация проходила путь от бактерии до пост космической эры и потом неизменно уничтожалось Creeper'ом, после чего все начиналось заново). Какие-то цивилизации держались дольше, какие-то меньше, но Creeper рано или поздно уничтожал каждую.

[h1]Как с ним сражаться?[/h1]
Игрок может строить пушки, испаряющие Крипера, приподнимать ландшафт, строить стены. Обычно цель - сдержать напор и уничтожить Источники. При этом высота Крипера может достигать десятков метров (максимальная высота стены = 10 метров), так что ваши наземные юниты могут видеть крипера даже через крепостные стены в виде большой горы на горизонте, состоящей из фиолетовой биомассы.

[h1]Какова задача?[/h1]
Чаще всего игроку при помощи различного оружия и инструментов приходится отвоёвывать у Крипера ландшафт. Иногда ситуации довольно нестандартные сами по себе, при этом игрок имеет определенную свободу выбора, как действовать в том или ином случае. 

[h1]Рандомный момент[/h1]
Один раз у меня не хватало сил полностью выбить Крипера с острова, я мог только освободить от него несколько тайлов, после у самолетов заканчивались бомбы и они улетали на базу, а на очищенное пространство почти сразу накатывало очередное цунами из фиолетовой биомассы. Возникла гениальная идея - во время одного такого освобождения я сумел приподнять ландшафт, и тогда накатившее цунами не затопило участок, в результате я наконец получил плацдарм на острове.

27962607.review:
CW3:AE is simply amazing and addictive.
I remember playing CW1 long ago and loving every bit of it and though CW2 was very different i'm glad they went back to the original style with this one. It's like a mix of TD and RTS, it's like someone looked into the future of Tower Defence and brought it back into the present.

Besides the campaign and the surprisingly deep story, you have hundreds of handcrafted maps and thousands of random pre-generated maps(normal and challenging) and a map editor to share your maps with others. Basically, there is enough to play here.

In terms of play styles you could go for a speedy/aggresive or tactical approach, but there is an odd satisfaction of systematically taking over the map bit by bit, freeing it from the "Creeper". With the addition of being able to terraform the landscape things get very interesting, going from building your own castles/fortresses to creating artificial chokepoints for the Creeper to simply making the map right out flat as you go along.

All in all i would very much recommend getting it on or off sale, but as i said it's quite addictive.

27953562.review: It is vaguely tower defense...  you cannot control the path of your enemies with your towers, nor does your enemy have a path at all.  Your enemy is "creeper" - an obvious ripoff in name and behavior of Starcraft's creep.  It is goo which expands from a central point.  The goo will destroy your towers so you must keep it at bay.  The whole game is about first protecting your base from the goo then slowly pushing the goo back until you destroy the enemy target.  The graphics are a la 1989.  The gameplay is simplistic.  There is a lot of content, though.  If you are tolerant of poor graphics and this style of game sounds interesting, then it'll keep you occupied for a decent period of time for a low price.  I found it underwhelming, possibly because I like the more traditional tower defense, but I have played it a lot.

27425800.review:
I saw the word "Creeper" in the name and was curious if some kind of Minecraft ripoff had made its way onto Steam.  What I found was a highly addictive and unique stragegy game.

You face the creeper: a flood, literally, a fluid enemy pouring across the battlefield from emitters.  Later encountering corrupted machines and other new threats and rule-bending forces.  Your typical mission begins by dropping your HQ either far enough away or on defensible enough terrain to build up your economy and weapons to begin pushing back.  Branching out your energy network to lands secured by weapons fire (or other interesting units and abilities) to allow units to operate further and further afield, advancing step by step, until close enough to set up a special unit to destroy its source.

The games many maps are very diverse.  Fighting on all sorts of mundane and exotic planet surfaces, fragmented worlds, moons, asteroids, vast artificial structures etc.

Your economy is energy.  You recieve a constant income of energy from collectors and reactors, which require either plenty of creeper-free land or large investments of energy.  Energy functions as the building material for units and their ammo.  Losing a chunk of your income, or a link in your network of collector and relay nodes, or just spend it on doing too much at once and your weapons will have only several seconds worth of stored energy before that wall of firepower becomes a trickle, or nothing at all.

The main con with this game I think is that, with the exception of a few time sensitive missions, you are very unlikely to lose once you have built a decent defense early in the mission.  Once that is accomplished, a player be as slow and patient as they like, lazily inching things forward one at a time as much as terrain allowed.

I might have played CW3 that way, and been left with a feeling I wasn't challenged, and that there weren't many important strategic decisions to make... if not for one simple feature: leaderboards for best completion times.  This is one of the few games that have managed to interest me trying to get into the Top-Whatever ammount.  I recommend doing so, it greatly enhances CW3's challenge and replayability.

Unfortunately, the leaderboards are polluted with illegitimate scores, particularly in the main campaign and most popular other maps.  I mean times well below what it takes to build, charge and fire a single nullifier even in the best conditions filling the Top 10's and 20's; with legitimate champs finding themselves in around the Top 30's... so at least it's still meaningful to be in the Top 100's.

27042863.review: If you liked the original Creeper World, this is the game for you. While the graphics aren't stunning and the story isn't exactly immersive, the gameplay is simple and you can easily spend hours on just one level (out of hundreds of available levels). This game is a perfect twist on the classic tower defense game, where it's easy enough to learn in minutes, yet each level brings new surprises. I feel like Creeper World is one of the best time-killing strategy games, as I can easily sit down and play through three levels, taking anywhere from twenty minutes to two hours apiece. Without a doubt, I would highly recommend Creeper World III to anyone who liked the original.

I've been playing this game series for years on flash game websites. This game always manages to entice me to come back to it. It really accomodates a variety of playstyles, from the slow methodical domination strategy, to the clever direct to the goal strategy, from brushing through and taking the point loss to end the map quickly to micromanaging every frame of the game. With the addition of player created maps into the mix it gets even more fun, I've become addicted to the special game modes available in the player created maps specifically one where your role is reversed, this is a great game with simple enough mechanics to learn but the option to find levels that rely on tactics that are hard to master. 26981401.review:
A game in which you literally defend against waves of enemies and in which your base truly gets flooded.

In Creeper World 3 you are in the middle of the "man vs nature" conflict. You are the man, and the nature is a purple, mindless goo that just spreads everywhere - unless you stop it.
And somehow despite the poor, if not awful, graphics, despite the awkward UI and despide performance issues, I find myself draw to this title more so that to any other tower defense game. Perhaps it's the joy of building your energy network, perhaps it's setting and fighting for the the perimitier, or perhaps it's the slow and steady reclaiming the world from the goo after you manage to hold it off.

Give it a try, especially if you like tower defense games, but are tired of playing the same one over and over, just with different skins.

26928541.review:
An awesome game for fans of defense, strategy, and single-player RTS games.  Near infinite replayability beyond the campaign levels with extra-hard levels/custom-created maps (the game has its own scripting language that diehard fans are exploring tremendously).

Pros:
-The liquid-based enemy of the Creeper is totally unique
-Satisfying "combat" and a real feeling of accomplishment that is visually rewarded when overcoming an obstacle (Your energy grid and supply lines grant amazing visual feedback)
-Surprisingly deep decision making for some of the harder maps, but everything is always fair - no cheap shots or surprises
-Play at your own pace, pausing to build or plan ahead, and saving/loading whenever you want (You can play a mission slowly and safely and eventually overcome anything, or push yourself to the limit and try to beat them even faster or more efficiently)
-Low cost for the amount of replayability offered
-Highly customizable - Sound, controls, visibility/colors of elements on the game screen

Cons:
-There's a definite learning curve beyond the main missions that may seem off-putting at first - complexity of units, resources, mechanics, terminology
-Fans of defense games with direct player combat/intervention (FPS controls or special abilities) may not like the nearly fully automated weapons/enemy
-The art style is a bit simplistic, even if you're a fan of pixel art-y or tiny models, and can cause the visuals to blend together for new players
-Some of the sound design can get repetitive, especially when you've got large scale bases and battles

26453410.review:
Ok. Creeper World 3 is an amazing RTS. You need to build your base, collect resources and build defences to protect yourself against the overwhelming enemy that quickly grows in power and takes over the whole map. When you grow strong enough, you start pushing back, shooting your way through the enemy forces. You need to make sure that your assault is well covered, is connected to the supply line and that you won't run out of resources at a critical moment. 
You shoot down air units and lauch air assaults and bombarding deep in enemy territory. Oh, and NEVER forget about defending your land. A small mistake can be enough to screw up your plans.

It's extremely satisfying when you capture land and push further into the enemy territory, and destroy they structures. The game combines moments of despair, heroism and triumph. But there's one important detail.


You don't fight humans, but blue alien mass that spreads extremely fast and destroys everything in it's path. But despite this you still feel like you fight a war against a much stronger enemy.

The amount of different things you need to keep track off, the gameplay focused on tactical planning, the awesome music that's both dramatic and badass...




Oh, and did I mention the crazy amount of content? There are thousands of maps you can fight on in the official campaigns, and there's also a level editor and a random level generator.





In short: great RTS with a truckload of content. Buy it now.

26159161.review:
このゲームの初代をやったのはフラッシュゲームからだった。
その時は無料でできるチュートリアル的なものしかできず、それでも凄まじい時間をそれで費やした。
Steamではなく、公式の方でゲームは買って1作2作3作ともにプレイはしていたが、アカウントを忘れてしまったため3作だけでもSteamで購入。
3作目は初代をリメイクしたような作り。ストレージやリソース輸送速度等は初代ではリソースをつぎ込んで敵を出すポイントを破壊する。それを稼働させたときに出るポイントで強化が可能になった。
初代ではそのストレージや輸送速度を上げる設備をどう構築するかも楽しかったが、こっちはこっちでやることが単純になりスピーディーになった。

TDとは違い防衛戦を構築しその裏でリソースを瞬間出力を凄まじく上げ、
数　で　ぶ　ん　殴　る　。
大抵のマップはこれでどうにかなる。1マップのプレイ時間がだいたい1時間（！？）として、
5　0　分　は陣地構築と必要陣地奪取、これに費やされる。そしてその構築が一番楽しい。
今作では地面を任意の高度に整地するユニットがあるので、序盤である程度整地して陣地を構築しやすくすることもできるようになった。
これによりよりリソースの生産効率がアップしたり、城のような陣地を構築してみたりできるようになった。高度は1から10まで自在に変更できる。
簡単に10の高さと1の高さで堀を作ることだってできる。その分リソースは食われるが。
この整地は敵さえ地面に一瞬でもいなければ行われる。つまり、敵を排除するユニットと一緒に進軍させれば、高さ10をひたすら構築しその上をゴリゴリと敵湧きポイントまでゴリ押しすることも可能。

とまぁ大体のマップがこんな感じに時間をかければ好きなように攻略ができる。TD系ゲームは好きだがぎりぎりのリソース配分が苦手な人にはとてもおすすめする。


当然TD系のゲームが得意な人にも大丈夫。
初手をギリギリで構築しなければ即座に負けるようなマップ（小さいマップだと特に）もあります。


追記：ものすごぉおおおおおおおくメモリ喰います。グラボはおそらく意味がない（グラフィック設定が殆ど無いしそもそも高画質にする必要がない）ためメモリギガ数が少ない方はTDが得意な方（少数戦力とリソースで速攻かけられるプロ）かメモリ増量を行ってからのプレイをおすすめします。
当方16ギガのメモリですが中マップでも地面掃射エアユニットを15も作って稼働させれば4倍速がまともに動かない程度には遅くなります。

26146650.review:
超赞的塔防游戏！在游戏中，面对如潮水一般的史莱姆军团，你需要使用各种手段来组织并消灭它们。Creeper3与其它塔防类游戏不同，怪物没有固定的行进路线，不按单位计算，而是像水一般不断地扩散。而你对抗它们的手段，除去传统的枪炮以外，还有多种有趣的方式，例如建造高墙，挖坑，引导史莱姆们的流向，或是开启护盾，抵挡它们的前进，又或者是建造飞机，空投“反史莱姆”来跟他们争夺领地。总之，这是一款概念上十分有趣的塔防游戏。
	在关卡设计方面，根据地形的不同，你所需要制定的对抗策略也大相径庭。同时，有些任务中还会出现特殊的建筑，比如超级武器或者是巨型护盾等等，偶尔围绕着这些官方给的强力设施进行战斗也是相当有趣。
	敌人的种类也十分多样，除了最常见的产生史莱姆的孢子以外，还有能够远程抛射史莱姆的投掷者，以及能够在史莱姆上行走并破坏你沿途设施的怪物。甚至有一关，一个重力球围绕着整个地图巡回，牵引着沿途的史莱姆到处走。

+新颖的史莱姆设计
+多样的对抗方式
+游戏机制使得地形变得十分重要，关卡设计精彩
-画面略显抽象，单调
-游戏的压迫感不强，一旦挺过前期的强烈攻势，基本就胜券在握了（但是各种花式杀史莱姆还是很爽的）

8.5/10

25915398.review:
I love tower and defense type games especially the ones with high complexity. For all of Creeper World's unique building types, interesting building connections, and neat other ideas -- you're still fighting water. The story tries to turn the "purple water" into a menacing all encompassing alien blob, but it doesn't behave like one. Heck, the water moves in a really non-aggressive way like waves lapping at the shore. If you want a game with AI that adpats to your playstyle, look elsewhere.

The most stressful time in any given match is the first few minutes when you're building your base up. I've hit restart numerous times because of acting too slow (mostly since I'm watching TV at the same time); however, once you're up and running defeating creeper is not really about strategy or skills, it's more like a waiting game. You'll be slowly grinding out the time of waiting for buildings to construct or moving your buildings around. The only way this game is interesting is that it allows speed players to post their completion times for everyone to see.

While I do fawn over pixel art, Creeper World is very dated even for pixel graphics. There are loads more mobile games that look better than this. I will say that the strongest aspect of the aesthetic is the soundtrack. I never felt bored with the music and it gives this emergency type of rock background in the environment. Nontheless I turned it off so I could watch TV and youtube.

25836797.review:
Okay! Time for another review.   This time: Creeper World 3.  I'll just start right out by saying that I freaking love this one (and also that I've played it for more hours than it shown here... I hate pointing that out, but people get all weird about it).

Creeper World 3 is, at it's heart, a tower defense game.  The absolute most basic concept of placing towers or turrets to defend against an advancing foe is here.  And of course you have energy and such to manage.  But that's about where the similarities to normal TD games end.

The heart of CW3's genius is the enemy you face, simply known as Creeper, or Creep, whichever.  Instead of lots of seperate enemy units running at you in lanes (which ALWAYS seemed so freaking stupid to me in other TD games) the Creeper is a sort of... blue/purple goo.  EVIL goo.  This stuff spreads pretty much like you'd expect a liquid to, and the game renders/simulates/whatever this liquid really, really well, over a landscape that consists of varying levels of elevation (or sometimes, blank void areas that nothing can flow into or land on).  Your main targets in most maps are Emitters... big spiky blue things that are the source of the unending slime.   They just keep pumping it out, non-stop.  Since the Creep is pretty just a mindless liquid, it's behavior is very predictible.... but the fact that it's a liquid means that it can flow pretty much anywhere.  This is not a foe that's restricted to pre-set lanes.  And remember, this stuff JUST KEEPS COMING.  Sure, maybe a deep gorge might hold it for awhile.... but as it keeps pouring into that, eventually, it'll overflow.  It can get anywhere, eventually.

Fortunately though, breaking the norms yet again, you also have the ability to work anywhere on the map.  Your towers are not restricted to specific spots like in most games, and this is the other half of the brilliance of the game.  If there's available space, you can build something there.  And most of the things you can build are actually pretty darn small... you can fit TONS of things around, which you'll be doing.

Just dropping towers isnt enough though.  Like I said, the Creeper NEVER STOPS COMING.  As long as emitters exist, they'll keep making more.  They'll never stop until you destroy them.  So you cant just hold a defensive line forever.  And this is why, unlike other games, you're actually expected to ADVANCE, taking more and more territory for yourself, and reaching and destroying each emitter or other major enemy structure.  To accomplish this, your turrets can fly.  You can uproot them at any time, and give them orders to move to any other spot where there is room.  It's simple, and you'll find yourself doing it really, really often.   It's a major part of the game, and has alot of possible uses.

Of course, you have your limitations.  You only have so much energy to go around, and this energy is generated by your "network", made up of collectors (pull in energy from the surrounding landscape), reactors, and relays, among other things.  Collectors and relays create lines between them; energy and other resources can flow along this spiderweb of nodes, usually in the form of little colored spheres or blocks.  For the most part you really only use energy when something is requesting it; when building a new object, or when an old object needs a refill on energy/ammo/ore/whatever.   So your energy usage will leap up and down depending on what you're doing... dealing with it isnt simple as your network grows into more and more of a hideous tangled mess.  

And there's so much more than just that... the network is complicated enough, but the game has tons.... and tons.... of different mechanics and turrets and gizmos to use or deal with.  There are things like Strafers, which arent turrets at all but are planes that launch from pads you build, which will go off and perform strafing runs against the goo in whatever area you tell them to.  Not everything is a tower.  That fact adds even MORE complexity.   On the other side of things, not every threat is the Creeper itself.   Early on you'll be introduced to Spore Towers, for instance... nasty structures that sit there for awhile charging, before letting off this huge blob through the sky towards your structures.  Or a variety of other things that exist to assist the goo and make your job so much more difficult.  

The good thing is, the game does a really excellent job of easing you into all of these different concepts.  The campaign is very good at teaching you.  However, one way or another the complexity is very high here.  Be prepared for a complex challenge.... but that's what you want, isnt it, from a strategy game?  

The best part though is that this game has incredible replay value.  After you're done with the campaign, there's all sorts of other stuff to do.  Including downloading and playing maps made by other players, or using the random map generator (which in itself is very highly customizable, so you get the sort of map you're looking for) to create new challenges for you on demand.  I've seen plenty of players get hundreds of hours out of this game... the replayability absolutely is backed up by the game's incredible depth and potential for challenge, and is something you can just keep coming back to.

And one other thing I'd like to point out, and this is possibly the best part for me:  This is a very ACTIVE game.  Alot of TD games have you sitting around waiting for stuff.  But this?  No.  There's always something for you to DO.  When you're not setting up defenses, you're pushing forward.  When you're not dealing with your towers, you're expanding your network, or perhaps changing Strafer/Bomber routes, or dealing with an unexpected breach in your defenses, or perhaps using your terraformers to deform the terrain or build walls (yep, you can do that in this).... and all sorts of other things.  If you ARE finding yourself  in a dull moment, typically it means there's stuff you COULD be doing... you just arent.  And that can come back to bite you pretty hard, so you want to make sure you're always aware of your options at all times.  Really though, the game's flow/pace is superb.  Always something happening and always something to do.... no moments of sitting there and waiting.  Oh, and you can speed up time, too, if you want.  I never really do that myself though.  And there's a ton of approaches to every situation.  Your playstyle is up to you... the game generally doesnt force you into specific approaches.

Oh, and a word about the graphics:  They're fantastic.  This is a colorful, VIBRANT game, where everything stands out, yet is very easy to differentiate.  It's super easy to see what everything is at a glance.  Overall I really just freaking love the way this game looks.  

Overall, I really cant recommend this game enough.  This is a brilliant strategy game that breaks so many of the usual rules of TD games, replacing the broken bits with new bits that are so much more awesome and fun than the old bits.  If you love strategy games of any type, if you love a challenge, and if you want some real, major replay value, something you can constantly come back to.... you'll find it here.  I cant recommend this enough.

Just... try not to move your towers directly ONTO the goo.  That's just embarrassing.

25666595.review:
I could see myself playing a little bit more, but considering the 2 hour limit in order to get a refund, I'll rather stop now. In order to still somehow write a meaningful review I've read a lot about what others had to say (both good and bad) and watched videos online.

The problem for me is simple: Every mission is the same basic concept + you are not fighting against any sort of AI, but against some fluid goo which always spreads, you always stop, and then you grind your way forward to destroy it. It's weirdly enjoying and at the same time surprisingly non-engaging. You could play it while watching a film, especially once you have set up base. I can understand how people sink hours into it, just how some people sink hours into mindless point-and-click games, but I see no strategic depth here.

Positive Reviews actually acknowledge that to some degree, and the ones talking about any sort of "strategic depth" do a bad job explaining what exactly they mean, while the bad reviews are criticising the same thing, and some of those people have clocked considerably more hours than me.

This + looking at videos online has led me to the conclusion that these basic game mechanics don't change, sure there are buildings to unlock, and some tools you have to use in certain situations, but I can't see any possibility of strategic depth with this kind of concept.

It would get a good review for 2,49$, maybe for 4,99$ even, I could see myself playing it for a few more hours or sometimes to just waste time, but for 14,99$ I expected more. So get it while on sale, and stop before the 2 hour mark to rethink your investment. It's somewhat enjoyable, but more of a time-waster instead of an engaging game that will make you think.

25644201.review:
I love this game. The gameplay is unlike any other and is so innovative. The story missions are mostly tutorial missions that add more technologies but they also introduce a new custom element to the game every mission. One one mission it's creeper that appears across the entire map but is spawned by a single emmitter that you have to fight to get to. On another you have to eliminate all creeper on three different structures to active a weapon powerful enough to let you push to the boss of the map.

Those custom elements are done through a simple coding system which is why I keep playing the game. The community made maps which are easily accessible through the main menu have custom elements that are new and exciting. One popular one is getting to play as the Creeper. In another popular mode, you fight a creeper powered version of your own units. There's so many awesome community made maps that I love playing which is why I keep coming back to the game.
